did.unittitle: Michael D. Whitty papers 1986-1995
did.abstract: Professor of management and labor relations at the University of Detroit-Mercy; researcher and lecturer on social issues within the business world. Studies include the impact of AIDS within the workplace. Biographical information, publications and conference papers, collected material relating to AIDS and AIDS awareness.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The papers were given to Cruise Magazine from an unknown donor. The magazine later gave the materials to Midwest AIDS Prevention Project. The library received the materials in August 2001. Donor no. 9122.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Michael D. Whitty Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Michael D. Whitty (1942-) researches and lectures locally and abroad regarding social issues within the business world. His studies include AIDS in the workplace, the Americans with Disabilities Act, the global workplace, men's health, the role of spirituality within the business world and the future of work. Whitty, also known as Dr. Detroit, is an activist involved with workers' rights, sensitivity in business, and various AIDS organizations. Some of his activities include the Global Health Promotion Project, the AIDS Law Project, Corporate AIDS Project, and the AIDS Education Project. His education includes an A.B. from the University of Detroit (1960), an M.A. from the University of Michigan (1964), and a PhD from Syracuse University (1969). He is currently a professor of Management and Labor Relations at the University of Detroit-Mercy.

scopecontent.p: The Michael D. Whitty papers detail his professional and personal interest in AIDS during the late 1980s and early 1990s. The majority of the collection consists of research papers regarding AIDS policy in Michigan workplaces. Whitty presented his findings at several conferences focusing on AIDS in business. His personal interest in AIDS and human rights is best documented in his topical files.

scopecontent.p: The biographical series consists of one folder. It contains vitae, bibliographies, and several short biographical sketches of Whitty.

Papers and Publications

scopecontent.p: The papers and publications series is divided into articles written or co-authored by Michael Whitty and collected papers by other authors. The majority are non-published works by Whitty and his colleagues. Many of the papers address AIDS issues within the business world including employee relations, curriculum development, sensitivity training, health accessibility, and legal issues.

Conferences

scopecontent.p: The next series details conferences Whitty attended and, in most cases, at which he presented papers. Each folder contains conference itineraries and accompanying material. Some of the folders contain correspondence concerning the lectures, presentation transcripts, planning meeting minutes, event publicity, and clippings. One folder, AIDS in the Workplace, includes a survey research project. It samples opinions regarding AIDS policy and employee relations across Michigan businesses. The questionnaire and survey data are included in the folder.

Topical Files Regarding AIDS

scopecontent.p: The topical files series include AIDS-related materials collected by Whitty. Included are policies of Michigan companies and public organizations. His role as an activist is shown through his files regarding AIDS support and awareness groups.
